intro: Luma ereophila, commonly known as the silver flame tree, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking silver-white leaves and showy, pinkish-red flowers. The plant thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in coastal areas and disturbed soils. Its rapid growth and ornamental value make it a popular choice for landscaping. However, it can become invasive in certain regions, outcompeting native vegetation.
